glite.user.name.description: Name of the user account used to run the gLite services on this LB node

glite.user.group.description: Group of the user specified in the 'glite.user.name' parameter. Leave it empty of comment it out to use the same as 'glite.user.name'

lb.database.name.description: The mySQL database name to create for storing LB data In this version it must be set to the given value

lb.index.list.description: Definitions of indices on all the currently supported indexed system attributes

lb.database.username.description: The username to be used to access the local mySQL server In this version it must be set to the given value

GLOBUS_LOCATION.description: The location of the Globus Toolkit

rgma.servicetool.enable.description: Publish log server via RGMA servicetool. If this variable is set to 'false': the other values of this instance are not taken into account.[Example: 'true'] [Type: 'boolean']

rgma.servicetool.name.description: RGMA servicetool variable: Name of the service. This should be globally unique. [Example: 'your.host.name_lb'] [Type: 'String']

rgma.servicetool.url_endpoint.description: RGMA servicetool variable: URL to contact the service at. This should be unique for each service. Use example and adapt host. [Example: 'http://your.host.name:0/LB/lbServer'] [Type: 'string']

rgma.servicetool.service_type.description: RGMA servicetool variable: The service type. This should be uniquely defined for each service type. Currently two methods of type naming are recommended: (1) The targetNamespace from the WSDL document, followed by a space and then the service name. (2) A URL owned by the body or individual who defines the service type. [Example: 'Logging and Bookkeeping Server'] [Type: 'string']

rgma.servicetool.service_version.description: RGMA servicetool variable: Service version in the form 'major.minor.patch' [Example: '1.2.3'] [Type: 'string']

rgma.servicetool.publish_interval.description: RGMA servicetool variable: How often to check and publish service status. [Example: '60'] [Type: 'string'] [Unit: 'seconds']

rgma.servicetool.status_script.description: RGMA servicetool variable: Script to run when determining the service status. This script should return an exit code of 0 to indicate the service is OK, other values should indicate an error. The first line of the standard output should be a brief message describing the service status (e.g. 'Accepting connections') Example: '/opt/glite/etc/init.d/glite-lb-locallogger status'] [Type: 'string']

rgma.servicetool.status_interval.description: RGMA servicetool variable: How often to check and publish service status. [Example: '30'] [Type: 'string'] [Unit: 'seconds']

rgma.servicetool.url_wsdl.description: RGMA servicetool variable: URL of a WSDL document for the service (leave blank if the service has no WSDL). [Example: 'http://example.rl.ac.uk/service?WSDL'] [Type: 'string']

rgma.servicetool.url_semantics.description: RGMA servicetool variable: URL of a document containing a detailed description of the service and how it should be used. [Example: 'http://example.rl.ac.uk/service/semantics.html'] [Type: 'string']
